info.title: Amazon Lookout for Metrics
info.description: This is the Amazon Lookout for Metrics API Reference. For an introduction to the service with tutorials for getting started, visit Amazon Lookout for Metrics Developer Guide.

servers.description: The LookoutMetrics endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The LookoutMetrics endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description: Make changes to an existing alert.

allOf.description: The ARN of the updated alert.

AlertArn.description: The ARN of the alert to update.

AlertSensitivityThreshold.description: An integer from 0 to 100 specifying the alert sensitivity threshold.

Action.description: A configuration that specifies the action to perform when anomalies are detected.

allOf.description: The ARN of the IAM role that has access to the target SNS topic.
The ARN of the target SNS topic.

The format of the SNS topic.

  • JSON – Send JSON alerts with an anomaly ID and a link to the anomaly detail page. This is the default.

  • LONG_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with information about the impacted timeseries and a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for email.

  • SHORT_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for SMS.
Contains information about the SNS topic to which you want to send your alerts and the IAM role that has access to that topic.
A configuration for an Amazon SNS channel.
The ARN of an IAM role that has permission to invoke the Lambda function.
The ARN of the Lambda function.
Contains information about a Lambda configuration.
A configuration for an AWS Lambda channel.

AlertFilters.description: The configuration of the alert filters.

allOf.description: The list of measures that you want to get alerts for.
The name of the dimension to filter on.
The list of values for the dimension specified in DimensionName that you want to filter on.

items.description: The dimension filter, containing DimensionName and DimensionValueList.

allOf.description: The list of DimensionFilter objects that are used for dimension-based filtering.

post.description: Updates a detector. After activation, you can only change a detector's ingestion delay and description.

allOf.description: The ARN of the updated detector.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The ARN of the detector to update.

KmsKeyArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS KMS encryption key.

AnomalyDetectorConfig.description: Contains information about a detector's configuration.

allOf.description: The frequency at which the detector analyzes its source data.

post.description:
Describes a dataset.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

allOf.description: The ARN of the detector that contains the dataset.
The time at which the dataset was created.
The time at which the dataset was last modified.
After an interval ends, the amount of seconds that the detector waits before importing data. Offset is only supported for S3, Redshift, Athena and datasources.
The function with which the metric is calculated.

items.description: A calculation made by contrasting a measure and a dimension from your source data.

allOf.description: A list of the metrics defined by the dataset.
The name of the timestamp column.
The format of the timestamp column.
Contains information about the column used to track time in a source data file.
Contains information about the column used for tracking time in your source data.
A list of the dimensions chosen for analysis.
The interval at which the data will be analyzed for anomalies.
The time zone in which the dataset's data was recorded.
The ARN of an IAM role that has read and write access permissions to the source S3 bucket.
A list of templated paths to the source files.
A list of paths to the historical data files.
The level of compression of the source CSV file.
The character set in which the source CSV file is written.
Whether or not the source CSV file contains a header.
The character used to delimit the source CSV file.
A list of the source CSV file's headers, if any.
The character used as a quote character.
Contains information about how a source CSV data file should be analyzed.
Contains information about how a source CSV data file should be analyzed.
The level of compression of the source CSV file.
The character set in which the source JSON file is written.
Contains information about how a source JSON data file should be analyzed.
Contains information about how a source JSON data file should be analyzed.
Contains information about a source file's formatting.
Contains information about a source file's formatting.

An IAM role that gives Amazon Lookout for Metrics permission to access data in Amazon CloudWatch.

Contains information about source data used to generate metrics.

The dimension that you want to filter on.
The value that you want to include in the filter.

items.description: Describes a filter for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension that you want to include and the condition statement. The condition statement is specified in the FilterOperation object.

allOf.description: The list of filters that you are applying.

items.description: Describes a list of filters for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension and one of its values that you want to include. When multiple dimensions or values are specified, the dimensions are joined with an AND operation and the values are joined with an OR operation.

allOf.description: The dimensions and their values that were used to filter the dataset.

post.description: Returns a list of measures that are potential causes or effects of an anomaly group.

allOf.description: The ID of the anomaly group.
Whether a measure is a potential cause of the anomaly group (CAUSE_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP), or whether the measure is impacted by the anomaly group (EFFECT_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP).
For potential causes (CAUSE_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP), the percentage contribution the measure has in causing the anomalies.

items.description: Aggregated details about the measures contributing to the anomaly group, and the measures potentially impacted by the anomaly group.

allOf.description: Aggregated details about the measures contributing to the anomaly group, and the measures potentially impacted by the anomaly group.
The pagination token that's included if more results are available.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

AnomalyGroupId.description: The ID of the anomaly group.

RelationshipTypeFilter.description: Filter for potential causes (CAUSE_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP) or downstream effects (EFFECT_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP) of the anomaly group.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return.

NextToken.description: Specify the pagination token that's returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.

post.description: Returns details about the requested data quality metrics.

allOf.description: The start time for the data quality metrics collection.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data quality metric array.
The name of the data quality metric.
A description of the data quality metric.
The column that is being monitored.
The value of the data quality metric.

items.description: An array that describes a data quality metric. Each DataQualityMetric object contains the data quality metric name, its value, a description of the metric, and the affected column.

allOf.description: The array of data quality metrics contained in the data quality metric set.

items.description: An array of DataQualityMetric objects that describes one or more data quality metrics.

allOf.description: An array of DataQualityMetricList objects. Each object in the array contains information about a data quality metric.

items.description: Aggregated details about the data quality metrics collected for the AnomalyDetectorArn provided in the GetDataQualityMetrics object.

allOf.description: A list of the data quality metrics for the AnomalyDetectorArn that you requested.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector that you want to investigate.

MetricSetArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a specific data quality metric set.
The ARN of the dataset to update.

allOf.description: The function with which the metric is calculated.

items.description: A calculation made by contrasting a measure and a dimension from your source data.

Offset.description: After an interval ends, the amount of seconds that the detector waits before importing data. Offset is only supported for S3, Redshift, Athena and datasources.

TimestampColumn.description: Contains information about the column used to track time in a source data file.

allOf.description: The name of the timestamp column.
The format of the timestamp column.

MetricSource.description: Contains information about source data used to generate metrics.

DimensionFilterList.description: Describes a list of filters for choosing specific dimensions and specific values. Each filter consists of the dimension and one of its values that you want to include. When multiple dimensions or values are specified, the dimensions are joined with an AND operation and the values are joined with an OR operation.

allOf.description: The dimension that you want to filter on.
The value that you want to include in the filter.

items.description: Describes a filter for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension that you want to include and the condition statement. The condition statement is specified in the FilterOperation object.

allOf.description: The list of filters that you are applying.

items.description: Describes a list of filters for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension and one of its values that you want to include. When multiple dimensions or values are specified, the dimensions are joined with an AND operation and the values are joined with an OR operation.

post.description:
Lists the datasets in the current AWS Region.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

allOf.description: The ARN of the detector to which the dataset belongs.
The time at which the dataset was created.
The time at which the dataset was last modified.

items.description: Contains information about a dataset.

allOf.description: A list of the datasets in the AWS Region, with configuration details for each.
If the response is truncated, the list call returns this token. To retrieve the next set of results, use the token in the next list request.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The ARN of the anomaly detector containing the metrics sets to list.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return.

NextToken.description: If the result of the previous request was truncated, the response includes a NextToken. To retrieve the next set of results, use the token in the next request. Tokens expire after 24 hours.

post.description: Returns information about the status of the specified anomaly detection jobs.

allOf.description: The reason that the run failed, if applicable.

items.description: The status of an anomaly detector run.

allOf.description: The pagination token that's included if more results are available.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

Timestamp.description: The timestamp of the anomaly detection job.

MaxResults.description: The number of items to return in the response.

NextToken.description: Specify the pagination token that's returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.

post.description:
Lists the alerts attached to a detector.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

allOf.description: The ARN of the detector to which the alert is attached.
The minimum severity for an anomaly to trigger the alert.
The time at which the alert was last modified.
The time at which the alert was created.

items.description: Provides a summary of an alert's configuration.

allOf.description: If the response is truncated, the service returns this token. To retrieve the next set of results, use this token in the next request.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The ARN of the alert's detector.

NextToken.description: If the result of the previous request is truncated, the response includes a NextToken. To retrieve the next set of results, use the token in the next request. Tokens expire after 24 hours.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results that will be displayed by the request.

post.description: Returns details about a group of anomalous metrics.

allOf.description: The start time for the group.
The end time for the group.
The ID of the anomaly group.
The severity score of the group.
The name of the primary affected measure for the group.
The number of anomalous metrics for the measure.
The severity score of the value.

items.description: The severity of a value of a dimension that contributed to an anomaly.

allOf.description: A list of dimension values that contributed to the anomaly.

items.description: Details about a dimension that contributed to an anomaly.

allOf.description: Details about dimensions that contributed to an anomaly.
Details about the dimensions that contributed to the anomaly.

items.description: Details about a measure affected by an anomaly.

allOf.description: A list of measures affected by the anomaly.

AnomalyGroupId.description: The ID of the anomaly group.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

post.description: Add feedback for an anomalous metric.

AnomalyDetectorArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

allOf.description: The ID of the anomaly group.
Feedback on whether the metric is a legitimate anomaly.

get.description: Gets a list of tags for a detector, dataset, or alert.

post.description: Adds tags to a detector, dataset, or alert.

tags.description: Tags to apply to the resource. Tag keys and values can contain letters, numbers, spaces, and the following symbols: _.:/=+@-

delete.description: Removes tags from a detector, dataset, or alert.

parameters.name: tagKeys
parameters.description: Keys to remove from the resource's tags.

allOf.description: The ARN of the IAM role that has access to the target SNS topic.
The ARN of the target SNS topic.

The format of the SNS topic.

  • JSON – Send JSON alerts with an anomaly ID and a link to the anomaly detail page. This is the default.

  • LONG_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with information about the impacted timeseries and a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for email.

  • SHORT_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for SMS.

The format of the SNS topic.

  • JSON – Send JSON alerts with an anomaly ID and a link to the anomaly detail page. This is the default.

  • LONG_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with information about the impacted timeseries and a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for email.

  • SHORT_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for SMS.

Whether a measure is a potential cause of the anomaly group (CAUSE_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP), or whether the measure is impacted by the anomaly group (EFFECT_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP).
For potential causes (CAUSE_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP), the percentage contribution the measure has in causing the anomalies.

items.description: Aggregated details about the measures contributing to the anomaly group, and the measures potentially impacted by the anomaly group.

allOf.description: The number of times that the measure appears.

ItemizedMetricStats.description: Aggregated statistics about a measure affected by an anomaly.

allOf.description: The ARN of the alert to update.
An integer from 0 to 100 specifying the alert sensitivity threshold.
The ARN of the IAM role that has access to the target SNS topic.
The ARN of the target SNS topic.

The format of the SNS topic.

  • JSON – Send JSON alerts with an anomaly ID and a link to the anomaly detail page. This is the default.

  • LONG_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with information about the impacted timeseries and a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for email.

  • SHORT_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for SMS.
Contains information about the SNS topic to which you want to send your alerts and the IAM role that has access to that topic.
A configuration for an Amazon SNS channel.
The ARN of an IAM role that has permission to invoke the Lambda function.
The ARN of the Lambda function.

A configuration for an AWS Lambda channel.
A configuration that specifies the action to perform when anomalies are detected.
Action that will be triggered when there is an alert.
The list of measures that you want to get alerts for.

The list of values for the dimension specified in DimensionName that you want to filter on.

MetricSource.description: Contains information about source data used to generate metrics.

allOf.description: The dimension that you want to filter on.
The value that you want to include in the filter.

items.description: Describes a filter for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension that you want to include and the condition statement. The condition statement is specified in the FilterOperation object.

allOf.description: The list of filters that you are applying.

items.description: Describes a list of filters for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension and one of its values that you want to include. When multiple dimensions or values are specified, the dimensions are joined with an AND operation and the values are joined with an OR operation.

allOf.description: Describes a list of filters for choosing specific dimensions and specific values. Each filter consists of the dimension and one of its values that you want to include. When multiple dimensions or values are specified, the dimensions are joined with an AND operation and the values are joined with an OR operation.
